description: This dashboard is designed to match the counters mentioned in document published by QUEST SOFTWARE on "SQL Server Perfmon Counters of Interest"

panels.description:
Unused physical memory (not page file).
Should be greater than 2 GB

targets.rawSql:
DECLARE @server_name varchar(256);
set @server_name = '$server';

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, (available_physical_memory_kb*1.0)/1024 as [Available Memory]
from DBA.[dbo].[dm_os_sys_memory]
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.server_name = @server_name
order by collection_time desc

panels.title: Memory - Available Mbytes

panels.description:
Pages Input/Sec
-- Should be less than 10
-- Reads from hard disk per second to resolve
hard pages.

Pages/Sec
Often referenced in older documentation.
Useful only in combination with Pages
Input/Sec, %Usage, %Usage Peak.

targets.rawSql:
DECLARE @server_name varchar(256);
set @server_name = '$server';

select master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time) as time, pc.counter_name, CEILING(pc.cntr_value) as cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and pc.server_name = @server_name
and pc.[object_name] = 'Memory'
and pc.counter_name in ('Pages Input/Sec','Pages/Sec')
order by pc.collection_time

panels.title: Memory - Pages Input/Sec, Pages/Sec

panels.description:
Paging File: %Usage
-- Should be less than 70%
-- Amount of Page File in use, which indicates
the server is substituting disk space for
memory.

Paging File: %Usage Peak
-- Should be less than 70%
-- Highest %Usage metric since the last time
the server was restarted.

targets.rawSql:
DECLARE @server_name varchar(256);
set @server_name = '$server';

select master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time) as time, pc.counter_name, CEILING(pc.cntr_value) as cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and pc.server_name = @server_name
and pc.[object_name] = 'Paging File'
and pc.counter_name in ('% Usage','% Usage Peak')

panels.title: Paging File Usage

panels.description:
< 80%. 
Percentage of processor time spent on SQL
Server process threads.You may also wish
to investigate other Process (sqlservr) such
as Private Bytes, Virtual Bytes, Working Set,
etc to get a fuller understanding of how
SQL Server allocates certain segments of
memory. Usually, these auxiliary counters
provide contextual information and are not
necessary for troubleshooting.

targets.rawSql:
DECLARE @server_name varchar(256);
--set @server_name = $server;

select /* Grafana => CPU */
		master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time,
		metric COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS,
		[value]
from (	select	collection_time,
				system_cpu_utilization as [% Processor Time (os)],
				sql_cpu_utilization as [% Processor Time (sqlservr)]
		from DBA..dm_os_ring_buffers
		where 1 =1 
		--and server_name = @server_name
		--and collection_time >= DATEADD(MINUTE,-120,getdate())
		and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
	 ) as up
UNPIVOT ([value] FOR metric IN ([% Processor Time (os)],[% Processor Time (sqlservr)])) AS UnPvt
--
UNION ALL
--
select  master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time) as time
		,metric = case when pc.[object_name] = 'Process' then counter_name + ' ('+pc.instance_name+')'
						when  pc.[object_name] = 'Processor' then counter_name + ' ('+pc.[object_name]+')'
					else null
					end  COLLATE SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS
		,[value] = pc.cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc with (nolock)
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and collection_time >= DATEADD(MINUTE,-120,getdate())
--and pc.server_name = @server_name
and	(	--(pc.[object_name] = 'Process' and counter_name like '!% % Time' ESCAPE '!' and pc.instance_name = 'sqlservr')
		--or
		(pc.[object_name] = 'Processor' and counter_name = '% Privileged Time')
	)
--and counter_name like '!% Processor Time' ESCAPE '!'
order by time

panels.title: %Processor Time (SqlServer)

panels.description:
Number of threads waiting for CPU cycles,
where < 12 per CPU is good/fair, < 8 is better,
< 4 is best.

Number of execution contexts switched in
the last second, where >6000 is poor, <3000
is good, and <1500 is excellent.

targets.rawSql:
DECLARE @server_name varchar(256);
set @server_name = 'MSI';

select 
		master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time) as time
		,metric = 'CPU - '+pc.counter_name+' ('+pc.[object_name]+')'
		,[value] = pc.cntr_value/si.cpu_count
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc with (nolock)
outer apply ( select top 1 cpu_count from DBA.dbo.dm_os_sys_info as si where si.collection_time <= pc.collection_time) as si
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and collection_time >= DATEADD(MINUTE,-20,getdate())
and pc.server_name = @server_name
and	(	(pc.[object_name] = 'System' and counter_name = 'Processor Queue Length')
		or
		(pc.[object_name] = 'System' and counter_name = 'Context Switches/sec')
	)
--and counter_name like '!% Processor Time' ESCAPE '!'
order by time

panels.title: Per cpu - Processor Queue Length/Context Switches

targets.rawSql:
select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name, cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:Access Methods'
and pc.counter_name not in ('Index Searches/sec')
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name, cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:Access Methods'
and pc.counter_name = 'Index Searches/sec'
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())

declare @server varchar(256)
set @server = '$server';

select	time = master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time),
		metric = pc.counter_name,
		[value] = pc.cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
--and server_name = @server
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and (	(pc.[object_name] = 'SQLServer:Memory Manager' and pc.counter_name in ('Granted Workspace Memory (KB)','Maximum Workspace Memory (KB)','Target Server Memory (KB)'))
	)
order by pc.collection_time

declare @server varchar(256)
set @server = '$server';

select	time = master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time),
		metric = pc.counter_name,
		[value] = pc.cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
--and server_name = @server
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and (	(pc.[object_name] = 'SQLServer:Memory Manager' and pc.counter_name in ('Memory Grants Outstanding','Memory Grants Pending'))
	)
order by pc.collection_time

declare @server varchar(256)
set @server = '$server';

select  /* Load on Disk */
		[time] = master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time),
		metric = counter_name+' ('+pc.instance_name+')',
		[value] = pc.cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc
where 1 = 1
--and server_name = @server
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and pc.[object_name] in ( 'LogicalDisk' )
and pc.counter_name in ('Current Disk Queue Length')
and NOT (pc.instance_name = '_Total' or pc.instance_name like 'Harddisk%')
order by pc.collection_time

declare @server varchar(256)
set @server = '$server';

select [time] = master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time),
		metric = counter_name+' ('+pc.instance_name+')',
		[value] = pc.cntr_value
--distinct object_name, counter_name, instance_name
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc
where 1 = 1
--and server_name = @server
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and pc.[object_name] in ( 'LogicalDisk' )
--and pc.[object_name] in ( 'PhysicalDisk' )
and pc.counter_name in ('Avg. Disk sec/Read','Avg. Disk sec/Write')
and NOT (pc.instance_name = '_Total' or pc.instance_name like 'Harddisk%')
order by pc.collection_time

declare @server varchar(256)
set @server = '$server';

select  /* Load on Disk */
		[time] = master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time),
		metric = counter_name+' ('+pc.instance_name+')',
		[value] = pc.cntr_value
		--distinct object_name, counter_name --,instance_name
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc
where 1 = 1
--and server_name = @server
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and pc.[object_name] in ( 'LogicalDisk' )
--and pc.[object_name] in ( 'PhysicalDisk' )
--and pc.counter_name in ('Current Disk Queue Length')
--and pc.counter_name in ('% Disk Time','% Idle Time','% Disk Read Time','% Disk Write Time')
and pc.counter_name in ('Disk Bytes/sec','Disk Write Bytes/sec','Disk Read Bytes/sec')
--and pc.counter_name in ('Avg. Disk sec/Read','Avg. Disk sec/Write')
and NOT (pc.instance_name = '_Total' or pc.instance_name like 'Harddisk%')
order by pc.collection_time

declare @server varchar(256)
set @server = '$server';

select [time] = master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time),
		metric = counter_name+' ('+pc.instance_name+')',
		[value] = pc.cntr_value
--distinct object_name, counter_name, instance_name
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc
where 1 = 1
--and server_name = @server
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.[object_name] in ( 'LogicalDisk' )
and pc.[object_name] in ( 'PhysicalDisk' )
and pc.counter_name in ('Avg. Disk sec/Read','Avg. Disk sec/Write')
and NOT (pc.instance_name = '_Total' or pc.instance_name like 'Harddisk%')
order by pc.collection_time

declare @server varchar(256)
set @server = '$server';

select  /* Load on Disk */
		[time] = master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time),
		metric = pc.instance_name,
		[value] = pc.cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters_nonsql as pc
where 1 = 1
--and server_name = @server
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and pc.[object_name] in ( 'Network Interface' )
and pc.counter_name in ('Bytes Total/sec')
order by pc.collection_time

panels.description: Monitor these counters to determine general benchmark levels set by your user databases and for tempdb.

targets.rawSql:
;WITH T_Dbs AS (
	select *
	from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
	where 1 = 1
	and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
	and pc.[object_name] = 'SQLServer:Databases'
	and pc.counter_name in ('Log File(s) Used Size (KB)','Log File(s) Size (KB)')
	--and pc.counter_name = 'Percent Log Used'
	and instance_name not in ('_Total','master','model','mssqlsystemresource')
	--and pc.cntr_value/(1024.0*1024) > 1.0
)
select [time] = master.dbo.local2utc(pc.collection_time),
		--pc.collection_time,
		metric = case when counter_name = 'Log File(s) Size (KB)' then 'Total Size (KB) - '+QUOTENAME(pc.instance_name)
						when counter_name = 'Log File(s) Used Size (KB)' then 'Used Size (KB) - '+QUOTENAME(pc.instance_name)
						else counter_name+' ('+pc.instance_name+')'
						end ,
		[value] = pc.cntr_value
from T_Dbs as pc
where pc.instance_name in (	select i.instance_name 
							from T_Dbs as i 
							where i.counter_name = 'Log File(s) Size (KB)'
								and i.cntr_value/(1024.0*1024) > 1.0
						)
order by collection_time

panels.title: SQLServer:Databases - Log File Usage ( > 1GB)

targets.rawSql:
select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name, cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:SQL Statistics' --and counter_name not in ('Memory Grants Pending')
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name, cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:Buffer Manager' and counter_name in ('Page lookups/sec','Page reads/sec','Page writes/sec','Readahead pages/sec')
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name, cntr_value
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:Buffer Manager' and counter_name not in ('Page life expectancy','Database pages','Target pages')
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())

panels.title: MSSQL Buffer Manager & Memory Performance Counters

targets.rawSql:
select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		--distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:Memory Manager' 
and counter_name in ('Total Server Memory (KB)','Target Server Memory (KB)')
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		--distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:Memory Manager' 
and counter_name in ('Stolen Server Memory (KB)','SQL Cache Memory (KB)','Free Memory (KB)')
order by pc.collection_time

panels.title: MSSQL How is My Memory Being Used Performance Counters

targets.rawSql:
select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		--distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:SQL Statistics' 
and counter_name in ('Batch Requests/sec','SQL Compilations/sec','SQL Re-Compilations/sec','SQL Attention rate')
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, instance_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		  --distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Locks'
and pc.counter_name = 'Number of Deadlocks/sec'
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, instance_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		--distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:SQL Errors' 
and pc.instance_name <> '_Total'
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		  --distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Transactions'
and pc.counter_name in ('Longest Transaction Running Time')
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		  --distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Transactions'
and pc.counter_name in ('Free Space in tempdb (KB)')
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		  --distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Transactions'
and pc.counter_name in ('Transactions')
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		  --distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Transactions'
and pc.counter_name in ('Version Store Size (KB)')
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		  --distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and (	pc.object_name = 'SQLServer:General Statistics'
		and	
		(	pc.counter_name in ('User Connections','Logins/sec','Logouts/sec') )
	)
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, counter_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		--distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Latches'
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, instance_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		--distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
--and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Locks'
and pc.counter_name = 'Lock Waits/sec'
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, instance_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		    --distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Locks'
and pc.counter_name = 'Average Wait Time (ms)'
order by pc.collection_time

select master.dbo.local2utc(collection_time) as time, instance_name as metric, cntr_value as [value]
		    --distinct pc.object_name, pc.counter_name, pc.instance_name, pc.cntr_type
from DBA.dbo.dm_os_performance_counters as pc
where 1 = 1
and collection_time BETWEEN master.dbo.utc2local($__timeFrom()) AND master.dbo.utc2local($__timeTo())
--and pc.collection_time >= GETDATE()-1
and pc.object_name like 'SQLServer:Locks'
and pc.counter_name = 'Lock Wait Time (ms)'
order by pc.collection_time

title: Monitoring - Perfmon Counters - Quest Softwares
